turns.speaker: WOODLY
turns.text: Minors aren't allowed at fights.

turns.speaker: SHUTTLE
turns.text: Then we'd stay home and eat venison or something, and look through the scrapbooks.  I've got a friend who has a whole freezer full of striped bass and caribou meat.  I'm going to bring that boy back.

turns.speaker: WOODLY
turns.text: "Happy Birthday, Wanda June!"

turns.speaker: SHUTTLE

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE
turns.text: We have this new club up here in Heaven.

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: Yes, we do.

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE
turns.text: We only have two members so far, but it's growing all the time.

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: We have enough for a shuffleboard team.  In Heaven, shuffleboard is everything.  Hitler plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE
turns.text: Albert Einstein plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: Mozart plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE
turns.text: Lewis Carroll, who wrote Alice in Wonderland, plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: Jack the Ripper plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE
turns.text: Walt Disney, who gave us Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, plays shuffleboard.  Jesus Christ plays shuffleboard.

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: It was almost worth the trip--to find out that Jesus Christ in Heaven was just another guy, playing shuffleboard.  I like his sense of humor, though--you know? He's got a blue-and-gold warm-up jacket he wears.  You know what it says on the back? "Pontius Pilate Athletic Club." Most people don't get it.  Most people think there really is a Pontius Pilate Athletic Club.

turns.speaker: WANDA JUNE

turns.speaker: VON KONIGSWALD
turns.text: You bet! "The Harold Ryan Fan Club." Pink, eh?  With a yellow streak up the back.  We got very good tailor shops up here.  They'll make you any kind of uniform, any kind of sweatsuit you want.  Judas Iscariot--he's got this black jacket with a skull and crossbones over the heart.  He walks around all hunched over, and he never looks anybody in the eye, and written on the back of his jacket are the words, "Go take a flying--

turns.text: Hello. My name is Beatrice. Have you been here before?

turns.text: What we offer here is nude body to body contact on a bed in a private room. It's twenty dollars a half hour, thirty dollars an hour. Anything else you desire may be discussed in the privacy of your room. Tips are allowed. We accept Bank Americard, Master Charge and American Express.

turns.text: I don't really want... 'body to body contact.'

turns.speaker: BEATRICE
turns.text: That you may discuss with the girl of your choice in the privacy of your room.

turns.text: No. I don't think so.

turns.speaker: BEATRICE
turns.text: You sure? We have regular sessions, too. Only twenty dollars?

Not the type! I can come ten times a day. I can keep it hard two hours at a time. My cock is nine inches long.

turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Brown. I'm sure you're very good, but at the moment, I've got nothing for you. If something comes up, we'll give you a call.

turns.speaker: BLACK STUD
turns.text: Shit! You just don't want to hire a nigger, that's all. I knew this was a scam. I shouldn'ta come.

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: The boy your daughter was talking to didn't work at the park. We've interviewed everybody there.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But is she, has...

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: There's no evidence of any foul play at present. I hope she's just a runaway.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There's something wrong here. Kristen is not the type of girl to just up and leave.

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: I said I hope she's a runaway. Better that than she just disappears like so many others do. Sometimes they turn up years later, sometimes not. A lot of crimes go unreported, unknown. These are realities.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: Two officers have been assigned to the case. I can't keep them on indefinitely, but we'll go through every lead.

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: Apparently your friend has gone into Mexico. A Border Guard responded to the APB. How does it feel to have the L.A.P.D. doing your work for you?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: You're going to thank me for this. You know what the media's like. They love this kinda shit. If that guy goes off half-cocked and gets himself hurt, you're going to have so much bad publicity, you...

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: I heard you the first time. We had nothing to go on with this kid. Just a runaway.  Do you really think he's in danger?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: If he has anything to say about it, yeah. I've been asking a lot of questions and I don't like the answers I'm getting. He's made a lot of people nervous, including some poor faggot who thought he was going to be a movie star.

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: We aren't gonna arrest him for that...

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Big threat. TV would ream you.

turns.speaker: BURROWS
turns.text: Keep me informed of what he's up to. You help me, I'll help you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: We offer Female Wrestling, that is, nude body to body contact, with a girl of your choice in a private room. Twenty dollars a half hour, thirty dollars hour. Any other arrangements may be discussed in the privacy of your room. Tipping is permitted. We accept Bank Americard, Master Charge and American Express.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Do you want to take a session?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I just want to ask some questions.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: You may do that in the privacy of your room.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay. I'll take a half hour.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Do you have any particular choice of girl?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You'll be fine.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: You're still dressed?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, I want to...

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Sit down. Make yourself comfortable. My name's Felice.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There's a girl I want to ask you about.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: You're not Vice, are you?  Do you work for the Los Angeles Police Department, or do you have any other affiliation with any law enforcement agency?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: I have to ask you that. If you were Vice you couldn't deny it. You ought to dress less square. You wouldn't get hassled so much. Here, let me help you get that tie off.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, actually I wanted to ask about this girl. I have her picture here.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Pull out your cock.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Cops aren't allowed to do that either. A judge ruled that that was entrapment. Don't ask me why. I guess he figured the sight of a Vice Officer's dong would make a girl unable to stop herself.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, Felice, I'm not a cop. In fact, right now I've got as little respect for the police as you do.  I'm looking for a girl. A runaway. I need someone to help me.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Are you going to stiff me?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Look, that twenty dollars you just paid, I don't get any of that. That goes to the guys that own this place. I get two bucks an hour, minus ten percent for a bail fund. I make all my money on tips.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You want a tip?

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Sure. What do you want? Tips can be anywhere from thirty dollars to seventy dollars.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: What do you want to tip me for? Look, you got to spell it out. Whatever you want, just say it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll give you a tip. Here's forty dollars.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Now, what do you want?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I said I just wanted to talk to you...

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: That's cool.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: ...about this woman.  I'm trying to find her. Do you know her?

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Look, I don't know anybody. I never seen her before.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm getting angry.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Wait a minute, that's going to cost you more than forty bucks.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm getting angry. I want some answers.  Where's the guy who runs this place?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who is it? That blond guy? Where is he? I'm going to talk to someone.

turns.speaker: FELICE
turns.text: Wait?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is he? Where's the bastard that runs this shit hole?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'd like to place a 'Personals' ad in the Free Press.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just one.

turns.text: The rate is a dollar per line, a dollar and a half bold face.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: GIRL AT THE WINDOW

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Not really. But if you want me to tone it down...

turns.text: No, no. I wouldn't hire a display designer if I didn't trust her taste. Maybe we should bring in more of that shade. Perhaps a stripe across the back wall.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: No, that would be much too overpowering.

turns.text: Yeah, overpowering. That was the word I was looking for.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Mr. Van Dorn, I've worked on the color scheme for weeks. I think it's just right.

turns.speaker: JAKE

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Pavonine. It's the same tint as the stripe in the fabric.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Are you still going with that fella that teaches at Grand Valley?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Sam?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah. He's a nice guy. Don't lose him. Maybe we could tone down this stripe a bit. It's a little...

turns.speaker: MARY

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Okay, Mr. Van Dorn, I think we could knock that Pavonine blue a bit.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Are you sure it's all right?

turns.text: Yes. I think it'll look better.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: She thinks so.  What do you do?

turns.speaker: JAKE

turns.text: No.

turns.text: It's your money. You talk.

turns.text: I'm making a film. Jim Sullivan's going to be in it. He said you might know where Tod is.

turns.text: You making a feature?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Um-hm. Live sound.

turns.text: Joanne?

turns.text: You know her?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: No. I saw her with Tod.

turns.text: Do you know where she lives?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Nah.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you know where she would be?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Tod might know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where's he?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Last I heard he went to San Diego.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: If we went there, would you be able to find him?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You're not a film producer, are you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How much do you make a week, Niki?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Are you a private detective?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Something like that. How much do you make?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Here? What a joke. There was some detective asking about that girl.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Three hundred?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: This is just temporary. I once made nine hundred in outcall.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll give you $700 a week, cash, if you help me find this girl.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Up front?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Half now, half later.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Make it nine hundred. That was my best week.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay. My client pays for it anyway.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: When do we start?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Tonight. When you get out, we'll go.  Why didn't you tell the other detective?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: This is different. This is nine hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I thought you were going to bed?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Niki. Calm down. Relax. Let's just talk for a while. Then, later, you'll go back to your room and we'll get some sleep.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You have anything to drink? You want to go out and get something?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't drink, but you can go out.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You don't drink?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ulcers.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You're not a private detective either, are you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I didn't think so. I've fucked detectives. Who are you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: A friend.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Of Joanne's?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.  I'm her father.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Her name is Kristen. She disappeared a couple of months ago.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: And your wife? Where's she?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She's dead.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Hey, don't worry about it. Your daughter's around. We'll find her in a couple days.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You really shouldn't eat like that. All that sugar. It's not good for you.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: At least I'm a growing person.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You won't keep growing at this rate.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: What rate?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You know what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You never met a working girl before, have you? You think I like sucking off guys all night? Maybe I do. So what?  You can't even say it, can you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Say what?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: 'Sucking off.'

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay. Sucking off. Now does that make me as good as you?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You don't understand shit.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay, tell me. Why do you live like you do?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Did you ever live in a room with six people and you didn't have any money, any food, any furniture? Have your brother come out, his car break down, he can't get a job? Your friends stealing food, going through trash behind a supermarket?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Is that the way it was with you?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: No. But does it make any difference?  How did you get to be the way you are?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Don't knock it. A girl can save up a lot money doing this -- big money. Then you're free. You can go off to Europe, meet somebody, get married. My girlfriend's going to buy her own beauty parlor. Not me. I'm gonna travel. 'Keep movin' that's my motto.  Would you rather work at Copper Penny at a dollar-eighty an hour, having every two-bit cocksucker able to yell at you? I can make more money suc... doing what I do for five minutes than I can all week at another job.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You used to work at Copper Penny?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You and I, Niki, have very different ideas about sex.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Why? Are you a sex fiend?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Neither am I.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But it's all you do.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: How important do you think sex is?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Not very.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: We're just alike. You think sex is so unimportant you don't do it. I think sex is so unimportant I don't care who I do it with.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't see why I must justify myself to you. I don't care about the things you do. I don't care what's happening in New York or Los Angeles. I don't care about movies or TV. I don't care who's on Johnny Carson.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: What do you care about?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I care about my daughter.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What's T-J?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Tijuana.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They were here?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Tod was.  He was with Ratan.

turns.text: He deals in pain.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Is Kristen safe?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You have to believe in something. What do they believe in -- the Whatjamacillit church?

turns.text: Christian Reformed. It's a Dutch Calvinist denomination.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Do they believe in reincarnation? I believe in reincarnation.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They believe in the 'TULIP.'

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: What the crap?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's an anagram. It comes from the Canons of Dort. Every letter stands for a different belief. T-U-L-I-P. Like -- are you sure you're interested in this?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, go on.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: T stands for Total depravity, that is, all men, through original sin, are totally evil and incapable of good. 'All my works are like filthy rags in the sight of the Lord.'

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Be that as it may. U is for Unconditional Election. God has chosen a certain number of people to be saved, The Elect, and He has chosen them from the beginning of time. L is for Limited Atonement. Only a limited number will be atoned, will go to Heaven.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Fuck.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I can stop if you want.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: No, please go on.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I is for Irresistible Grace. God's grace cannot be resisted or denied. And P is for the Perseverance of the Saints. Once you are in Grace you cannot fall from the number of the elect. And that's the 'TULIP.'

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Wait, wait. I'm trying to figure this out. This is like Rona Barrett. Before you become saved, God already knows who you are?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He has to. That's Predestination. If God is omniscient, if He knows everything -- and He wouldn't be God if He didn't -- then He must have known, even before the creation of the world, the names of those who would be saved.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: So it's already worked out. The fix is in?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: More or less.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Wow. Then why be good? Either you're saved or you ain't.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Out of gratitude for being chosen. That's where Grace comes in. God first chooses you, then allows you, by Grace, to choose Him of your own free will.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You really believe all that?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.  Well, mostly.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I thought I was fucked up.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll admit it's confusing from the outside. You've got to see it from the inside.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: If you see anything from the inside it makes sense. You ought to hear perverts talk. A guy once almost had me convinced to let his dachshund fuck me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's not quite the same thing.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: It doesn't make any sense to me.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Tod'll meet you at the bookstore at Eddy and O'Farrell tomorrow noon. I told him you were a 'specialty' customer.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why can't I meet him now?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Rot in hell, honey.  He's busy now.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where does he live.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Just a second. It's my ass I'm risking. You better do it my way. These fuckers don't mess around.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I must have been in more motel rooms this week than in the rest of my life. At least it feels that way.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I know what you mean. After a while they all look the same.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They are the same.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Do you live in a house back in wherever.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Grand Rapids? Of course.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: On your own land?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Look, I really don't know your daughter but...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I wouldn't expect too much. I mean about her coming back. Once a girl gets into the life.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What makes you so sure?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: You wife isn't dead is she?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Just a guess. She ain't dead though is she?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: She left you right?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.  She was the one called Joanne. How'd you find that out?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Just a guess. Did you have it good with your wife? You know, sex.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't blame you, Niki. Really I don't. It's this culture, where everything's based on sex, sold on sex...  ...magazines, music, TV. It's destroying everything. Buy this 'cause of sex, use this 'cause of sex. Kids think it's normal. They think they're supposed to talk dirty, wear scanty clothes...

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Don't get upset. I lied too. I don't make no five hundred dollars a week. Everything I make goes to Granville.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Granville?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: My man. 'Pimp.' I split 'cause he don't treat me for shit. Thinks he's so cool 'cause he's black. I once tried to take my clothes but he says, 'You can't take 'em 'cause they're my clothes -- I bought 'em.' Yeah, with my fucking money...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Look, Niki, this really isn't my business. I don't know anything about...

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: So I guess we're both fucked, huh? But at least you get to go to heaven. I don't get shit.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Did you find out where she was?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Tod gave me the slip. I have to find him again. Where does he live?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: I can't tell you that.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Listen, Niki. My daughter's been missing five months. I've gone through a lot to find out what's happened to her. I just saw a girl killed. I will not let Tod slip out of my hands. You have to tell me where he is.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: But then you'll forget about me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is he, Niki?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Those cops, like all cops, are intelligent enough, but they are masters of de-ductive reason. That is, you ask them what three and two are they'll tell you five, but if you ask them what five is, they go blank. That's spec-u-lative reasoning, and that's where I come in.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, what do they know?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Dogshit. Worse yet, they don't care.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: So then, Mr. Mast...

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Andy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: ...What do you have to offer?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Let me ask you a personal question, a painful one. The first of many. Tell me, was your daughter the kind of girl to run around, to, ah, play practical jokes, maybe?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: No, I didn't think she was. Let me get the picture here. Let me guess. She was an absolutely clean girl, a model daughter, she never had rebellious or impure thoughts, she didn't fuck around...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: If I was you, Mr. Mast, I'd watch my language.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Hey, I'm a private detective, Van Dorn, you want to hire a choir boy you can go back to Grand Rapids. I've been to that scumbag town. It's full of them.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who's paying you?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: You are.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: As I was saying, I'll pick up the thread. There's a number of ways I can go. There's not much you can do here. Stay if you want. Maybe it'd be better if you went back home. Go through Kristen's personal stuff. Ask around, maybe she knew somebody out here.  Look, I do this a lot. I work at a minimum rate of $750.00 a week. It may seem like a lot of money to you, but it ain't. You could hire cheaper.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And better?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I suppose. But I'll tell you, Jake, I'm like a little animal. When I get my teeth into something I never let go. If your daughter's here, I'll track her down.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Mr. Van Dorn?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Mast?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where are you? The connection sounds very good.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'm back in Grand Rapids.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: In G.R.? Why?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Can you meet me in about an hour? At the Pantlind Hotel?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I've got a meeting...

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: What are you paying me for?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll be there.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: This used to be a real city. I was here about fifteen years ago. Embezzlement case. It was always a little religious for my taste, but at least it was a city. With a downtown and all.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What have you found out?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I've got some news. Your daughter's all right. At least I think she is.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Have you ever seen any, ah, pornographic movies, Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Do you know what a "hardcore" movie is?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's like a stag film.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Yeah. You ever seen any of those?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: They're legal now.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They are?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Yeah.  All over. Even here in Grand Rapids.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: There's a little stall theatre up here.  It's closed now, but I'm borrowing it for an hour. I think there's something you'd better see.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where did you get that film?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I bought it at a store in L.A.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who made it?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Wait. Slow down. A film like this, 16mm, cost two three hundred dollars, sold outright, shown in peep machines, maybe theatres, maybe not, is almost impossible to track. 'Nobody' makes it; 'nobody' shows it; 'nobody' sees it. It's like it doesn't even exist.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What's it called?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: It was called 'Slave of Love' when I bought it. Next time it's sold, it'll be called something else.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But the police...

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: The police? They know less than you do.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you think she's safe?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Yeah. Probably.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You like this, don't you. Showing me... this.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I hate it. But you gotta know, buddy.  A lot of strange things happen in this world. Things you don't know about in Grand Rapids. Things you don't want to know about. Doors that should never be opened. I've known more about this sort of thing than a man should. Don't ask me why.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I ain't cheated you, Pilgrim. This is research, damn it! That girl could have told us something.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Research, my ass. I suppose these are the 'extra expenses' I've been paying for? And in the middle of the morning, too.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Oh, fuck off. You should stay where you belong.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Get out. Get out of here, Goddammit.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'm only human, you know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: But this is my apartment.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Get out!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I felt like such a shit, pilgrim, after what I did to you -- not that I did anything wrong -- that I kept investigating, poking around. There's some poor s.o.b. in L.A. with his face all bent out of shape who you've damaged his movie career. Lucky for him, people don't look at his face.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do the police want to arrest me?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Nah. They don't care about some faggot hustler. They're more interested in your daughter's health -- and yours. Like I am.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Listen, pilgrim, you're way out on a limb here. You don't know what you're into.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You sure as hell haven't been any help.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'm sorry about that. Have you found anything out? You've got to tell me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why don't you tell me something for a change?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who is Ratan?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Where'd you hear that name?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I just heard. Who is he?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: You know, it's possible to buy anything on this earth. You can buy child whores, slaves. You can have people raped, killed...  One of the men who supposedly arranges such things is named Ratan. He usually isn't in this country.  How'd you hear about him?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's just a name.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Don't do anything more. I'll find out what I can.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Does she know anything about this?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Who? The whore? No. She's just a victim. A dime a dozen.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: What happened, pilgrim?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just leave me alone.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: But I'm here to help you...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Andy, can you do something for her? Maybe money...

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Go home, pilgrim. There's nothing you can do. Forget this place. Start over.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You want to go for coffee after we send the girls off?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. Thanks anyway. I've got to get over to the office.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Anne wants to make sure you come over for dinner Sunday. With Kristen gone you'll be all alone.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What is it, Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Wes, Anne, come here a moment.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: They don't know. They were having some recreation deal out at Knott's Berry Farm and Kristen wasn't there when they got back to the bus and they couldn't find her.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Is Marsha there?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah. She's quite upset. I'm going to fly out today. They want me to bring some pictures.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'll come with you. Let me pack some things.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: How's your business, Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Pretty good.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You should come around more often. You haven't been around for weeks. Anne complains she doesn't see you anymore.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Jake?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How did you find me?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I called every L.A. hotel. The Holiday Inn gave this as a referral number. Your office said you had no business in New York, so I figured you had come out here.  What's happening, Jake? What are you doing? Nobody's heard from you. Anne's worried sick. We didn't know if you were dead or alive.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Wes, do me a favor.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Leave me alone. Go home. Go away.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just do what I say. Don't ask.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What is going on?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I think I've found a way to find Kristen. I have a plan. But I have to be alone.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What plan?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You don't want to know.  Now, Wes, leave, please. For me.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: What will I tell the others? They care about you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Tell them anything you want. Tell them I'm on a vacation, a business trip. Tell them I needed a rest. Tell them anything, just don't tell them...

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Hey man.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We're casting for an explicit sex action feature...

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: I know. Word's out on the street -- word's also out you ain't really hiring anyone.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's not true, Mr...?

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Jim Sullivan. Sometimes they call me Jism Jim.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's not true, Jim. In fact, I think you're very close to the type we're looking for.

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Oh yeah? I've done a lot of good stuff. Shorts, features. No major roles it's true. But good stuff.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's what I wanted to talk to you about.

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Oh yeah? I remember that. It was made by some college kids.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It was called 'Slave of Love.'

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: God, I don't know what it was called. I never saw it. I only got twenty- five bucks for the whole Goddamned thing.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I thought you were quite good in it. I also like the girl in it. Really thought she was good.  I wondered if she was still around. If she was still working.

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Hey, stop, stop. I'll do anything you want. It's okay. I can dig it. You can do anything you want to me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where is she? Where is the girl?

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: She's got a man. A white guy. Tod something or other.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where does he hang out?

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where!

turns.speaker: JISM JIM
turns.text: Look, I know this chick Niki. She works at Les Girls. She would know. Honest.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I hear you got money to spend.  I hear you're interested in... interesting things.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Do you work for the San Francisco Police Department, or do you have any other affiliation with any law enforcement agency?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: What you got in mind?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I want to meet Ratan.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: What is that? A kind of chair? I never heard of no Ratan.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I was told that there were certain things that only Ratan could provide.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: You're talking about real excitement?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah. I heard you and Ratan just came from Mexico. And that you had a film of a girl being, ah you know...

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Who told you about this?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Rucker.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I don't know no Ratan, but I may be able to help you out. It's not me, of course. Just helping out a friend. It'll cost you five hundred bucks for a single screening.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Is this with a girl named Kristen?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Um-hm. You got the five hundred?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Take it or leave it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Meet me here today at seven o'clock. With the money. Then we'll go see the film.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: What do you want?  Do I know you from somewhere?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I want to know where my daughter is. Her name is Kristen, or Joanne. She's with you.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: You wait here. I'll find out where she is.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You ain't goin' nowhere alone.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Where's Ratan?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: That film was a fake! Everything's phony...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Ratan!

turns.speaker: TOD
turns.text: Who the fuck knows? The Four Aces. He goes there.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Fifty cents admission.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: It's fifty cents admission. It's applicable to a purchase.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Do you have a, ah, film called 'Slave of Love?'

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: What we got is just these here.  What you see.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's a short film.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: They're all about the same. You want something?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: This is from the movie I was talking about.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I wondered if you had ever seen this film or this woman...  ...right here.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: That girl? No, never saw her. I don't know anybody.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm just trying to find...  Who owns this store?

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: I don't know. Look, man, if you're looking for somebody maybe you ought to see the cops.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But I...

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: I don't know nothing, man.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: You don't want anything for your fifty cents?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: Here. Take your fifty cents back.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's all right.

turns.speaker: TELLER
turns.text: No, take it. I don't want your Goddamn fifty cents.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. I walked up. Don't ride elevators.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: My secretary said you wanted to discuss a business proposition.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yes.  I'm interested in financing an adult feature film. I was told you were the man to come to.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: Film making can be pretty expensive...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I've got fifty thousand dollars to invest.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: Oh.  Why is it that you want to get into film financing?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, Bill -- mind if I call you Bill?  Let me be frank. I've made a lot of money. I've got my own business in Detroit. Rivets. I make rivets and sell them to Fisher Body.  Well, rivets, you know, can get pretty boring after a while. When my business manager told me I should shelter some money, I thought I'd try this.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: What exactly do you have in mind?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I thought I'd invest in a film. I want to sort of become involved in the process of making a film, meet the people who make films, learn how it's done...

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: In other words, you want to get laid?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Not exactly...

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: It's cool. Why do you think I got in the movies? How much poon do you think you get in the car wash business?  Look, fifty thousand dollars buys a lot of pussy. You can get your joint pulled by beautiful girls every night for the rest of your life for fifty thousand dollars. So why fuck with the movie business?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's an investment.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: If you want to watch when we shoot a film, for fifty bucks, I let guys stand around and watch. It's a lot cheaper.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I thought you were a businessman.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: Don't get me wrong. A couple years ago, I woulda jumped at fifty thousand dollars possible financing. But the Lord's been good to me. I can now finance any films I choose. Big ones, small ones. Right now we're setting up a two hundred thousand dollar feature film. Live sound. I like to keep my own money in my films. That way you don't have to share the profits. There's plenty of guys in town that'll take it, though. But if I was you, Mr... what was your name again?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Jake.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: ...I'd just start my own business. That's what I did. Get into kid porn. That's big now. Why don't you come around the set? Meet some people. If you still want to invest, I'll ask around.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sounds all right.

turns.speaker: RAMADA
turns.text: Okay. Keep in touch with my secretary.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I got a picture here. I want you to tell me where to find this woman. I been asking everybody. Nobody knows anything.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Calm down, mister. You don't want to get the cops in here do you? You got a family?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't suppose you've ever seen this girl before either? Her name's Kristen, but I suppose you've never seen her?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Why don't you just go outdoors, mister? Cool off.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Cool off, huh? How's this for cooling off?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Hold it, mister.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you think of that? Or this?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: You going to Knott's Berry Farm with him?

turns.speaker: MARSHA
turns.text: He asked me. You going with anybody?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARSHA
turns.text: You ever play Chicken?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MARSHA
turns.text: You never heard of that?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Com'on, tell me.

turns.speaker: MARSHA
turns.text: Well, a boy goes like this, see.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: What does that do?

turns.speaker: MARSHA
turns.text: Well, each time he comes in closer, like this.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Ssh. I'm on a stakeout.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'm staking out this beer bottle. Trying to find out if I'll finish it or it'll finish me.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I'm worried about Jake.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'm off that case. He fired me.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: He didn't look good at all. Something strange is going on. He's got himself into some trouble. He wouldn't say what.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I'll tell you, that was an interesting case. The Van Dorn girl. I've handled runaway cases like it before. Usually when you put the pressure on the porn underworld for an underage kid, she pops up in about a week. Everybody denies ever seeing her, but there she is at the airport with a prepaid ticket home. Well, I put pressure on all over town for this girl and it stayed cold as ice. In fact, certain people for this girl and -- nothing.  I guess I gave your brother-in-law sort of a raw deal.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I want to rehire you. To find out what's happening to my brother-in- law.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: I've been on another case. All day.  I suppose I can move it over. Seven fifty a week, plus travel expenses.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: Do you really think Kristen is just a runaway?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: I also want you to protect my brother- in-law.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: You have to understand. He can be mean, self-righteous. He had a Vishund once. Loved that dog. He came home one day and the dog bit him. He took that dog and staked him out in the back yard. It was winter. Every day he came home and watched that dog until he froze. He's capable of doing anything.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: To his own daughter?

turns.speaker: WES
turns.text: To anybody.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: You know Granville's looking for you, Niki?

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: My name ain't Niki. It's Pattica, like in Attica.

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: Granville's looking for you anyway.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: MAST
turns.text: The guy who bought you that ring.

turns.speaker: NIKI
turns.text: Well, he can just fuck himself.
